subsection.title: Paths

statement.p: A graph is a walk if and only if the vertices can be labeled v_0, v_1, \ldots, v_k such that v_i, v_{i+1} is an edge.
A graph is a trail if and only if it is walk such that no edge is used twice.
A graph is a path if and only if it is walk such that no vertex is used twice.

subsection.p: A path on n vertices is denoted P_n. Please note that these terms (walk, trail, and path) vary widely including reversing the names, so always check the definition in the article, book, or other material you are reading.

statement.p: A trail is Eulerian if and only if it uses every edge in the graph.
A path is Hamiltonian if and only if it uses every vertex in that graph.

statement.p: A graph G is connected if and only if for every pair of vertices v,w there exists a path from v to w.
A graph G is n-connected if and only if removing any n-1 vertices does not disconnect the graph.
